alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 7:10PM EDT until July 29 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Prince Edward County in central Virginia... Northwestern Lunenburg County in south central Virginia... Northwestern Nottoway County in south central Virginia... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 709 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Darlington Heights to near Saxe, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Farmville, Hampden Sydney, Hampden Sydney College, Longwood University, Burkeville, Darlington Heights, Rice, Green Bay, Prospect, Tuggle, Prince Edward Station, Briery, Arvins Store, Twin Lakes State Park, Kingsville, Plantersville, Elam, Blevins Corner, Pleasant Grove, and Meherrin. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
